intro: Reseda stricta, commonly known as upright reseda, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, yellow, and arranged in dense clusters, blooming from late spring to early summer. Reseda stricta is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in full sun to partial shade.
